text:
Raskolnikov sat on the sofa, tense. 

Porfiry watched him closely. 

Razumihin fidgeted at the table, eyes darting between them. 

“Fool,” Raskolnikov cursed silently. 

“I need to inform the police,” Porfiry said, serious. 

Raskolnikov hesitated. 

“I’m short on funds,” he stammered. 

Porfiry remained unfazed. 

“You can write to me instead,” he suggested. 

Raskolnikov nodded, feeling the weight of the moment.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov discusses a matter of business with Porfiry Petrovitch, revealing his financial struggles while trying to claim ownership of certain items related to a murder.
